intro: Richardsonia stellaris, commonly known as the starflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped blossoms, which typically range in color from white to yellow. The plant belongs to the family Onagraceae and is known for its delicate, herbaceous appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its flowers bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
